conclusion: To determine whether the distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is greater than or less than 100 meters, we need to analyze the v-t (velocity-time) graph provided.
The graph shows the velocity (v) of the skydiver over time (t). The velocity increases from 0 to 20 m/s over the first 10 seconds.

premise: The distance fallen can be found by calculating the area under the velocity-time graph from 0 to 10 seconds.
conclusion: The graph shows a curve that starts at 0 m/s and reaches 20 m/s at 10 seconds.

premise: The area under the curve represents the distance fallen.
conclusion: Since the velocity increases linearly from 0 to 20 m/s over 10 seconds, the shape under the curve is a right triangle.

premise: The formula for the area of a triangle is \( \text{Area} = \frac{1}{2} \times \text{base} \times \text{height} \).
conclusion: Here, the base is the time interval (10 seconds) and the height is the final velocity (20 m/s).

premise: The base is 10 seconds and the height is 20 m/s.
The area under the curve from 0 to 10 seconds is exactly 100 meters.
conclusion: The distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is exactly 100 meters.
